byline.contributor: Eric Schmitt contributed reporting from Washington, and Anne Barnard from Beirut, Lebanon.
byline.original: By HELENE COOPER and MICHAEL R. GORDON

abstract: Experts say Russia's military buildup in Syria is likely to lengthen tenure of beleaguered Bashar al-Assad government but is unlikely to influence outcome of war against Islamic State and may in fact worsen conflict; officials claim Russia's support of Assad allows it to pursue self-serving goal of establishing military outpost in Middle East.
lead_paragraph: On the long list of Moscow’s goals in building up its military presence in Syria, taking on the Islamic State is but one entry, foreign policy experts say.

headline.main: Russia Buildup Seen as Fanning Flames in Syria
headline.print_headline: Russia Buildup Seen as Fanning Flames in Syria

snippet: On the long list of Moscow’s goals in building up its military presence in Syria, taking on the Islamic State is but one entry, foreign policy experts say.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
